Discover Mexico

Your complete guide to Mexico's beaches, culture, cuisine, and adventure. From the Caribbean coast to ancient ruins, plan your perfect Mexican getaway.

Explore Destinations View Itineraries

Popular Destinations

From pristine Caribbean beaches to vibrant colonial cities, discover Mexico's most beloved destinations.

  • Bacalar

    Bacalar is home to Mexico's most breathtaking natural wonder—the 'Lagoon of Seven Colors,' a 55km freshwater lake displaying an impossible spectrum of blues and turquoises. This tranquil Pueblo Mágico offers a serene escape from the Riviera Maya crowds, with laid-back swimming, boat tours, cenotes, and a growing eco-conscious tourism scene.

    lagoon nature swimming

  • Cancún

    Cancún is Mexico's most popular beach destination, famous for its stunning turquoise Caribbean waters, powdery white sand beaches, and world-class resorts. Located on the Yucatán Peninsula, this tropical paradise offers the perfect blend of relaxation, adventure, and ancient Mayan culture, attracting over 6 million visitors annually.

    beach caribbean all-inclusive

  • Copper Canyon

    Deeper and larger than the Grand Canyon — Mexico's ultimate adventure in the Sierra Madre

    adventure train canyon

  • Cozumel

    Cozumel is Mexico's largest Caribbean island and one of the world's top diving destinations. Jacques Cousteau put this paradise on the map in 1961, and divers have been flocking ever since to explore the spectacular coral formations of Palancar and Santa Rosa reefs. Beyond diving, the island offers pristine beaches, laid-back vibes, and easy access from the Riviera Maya.

    island diving snorkeling

  • Guadalajara

    Guadalajara is Mexico's second-largest city and its cultural heart—the birthplace of mariachi music, tequila, and the charro (Mexican cowboy). This dynamic metropolis offers stunning colonial architecture, innovative culinary scene, vibrant neighborhoods, and serves as the gateway to the magical agave fields of Tequila country.

    city tequila mariachi

  • Guanajuato

    A rainbow city in a ravine — where underground streets, colorful houses, and musical traditions create Mexico's most magical urban landscape

    colonial unesco colorful

  • Holbox

    Holbox (pronounced hol-BOSH) is a car-free island paradise where sandy streets replace pavement, golf carts outnumber cars, and nature takes center stage. This bohemian Caribbean hideaway offers pristine beaches, legendary bioluminescent waters, whale shark encounters, and an authentically laid-back atmosphere that's increasingly rare in Mexico.

    island car-free whale-sharks

  • Huatulco

    Huatulco is Mexico's model sustainable beach destination—nine pristine bays with 36 beaches set against the lush Sierra Madre Sur mountains, all developed with ecological preservation in mind. This Oaxacan coastal gem offers excellent snorkeling, waterfalls, authentic Mexican culture, and resort comfort without the overdevelopment or crowds of northern destinations.

    beach eco-tourism snorkeling
